bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, February 18, 1921

div1.p: LePrince details his findings on stegomyia larvae in Laredo, Peru as well discussing the research of his colleagues.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to Henry Rose Carter, February 18, 1921
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Feb 18/21
Dear Dr Carter
div1.p:
Just got back from Laredo
yesterday- I have not yet had a
reply from Dr Howard re Stegomyia
at Carbondale Ill- Will advise you
as soon as I hear from him-.
At Laredo I found Stegomyia larvae
in all stages from just hatched to full
grown larvae - inspection of Feb 12th, 1922
also culex & plenty of egg boats of Culex-
Billingslea who is there tells me the
same condition re stegomyia larvae was true
during the first week in Jan 1921-

It looks as if stegomyia production
may be slowed up, & production reduced
by cold weather there but not stopped
by the cold in barrels out of doors at Laredo.

They had 2700 + barrels there when I
returned from Mexico but now have
only about 900 and have a fair
control on remaining barrels-

The mayor has two inspectors on
& Billingslea is doing good work there
also- Caldwell wrote me saying
(from my memory) there were about
115 cases of Y.F. reported in Mexico
last year-.1921-.

Mr. Chandler at Carbondale
Ill. (Entomologist State Dept
of Natural History) told me he
would keep tab on Stegomyia
breeding presence at the hotel where
we gathered them-

closer.seg:
Probably Griffitts has written
you Mobile is financing a
campaign this year- Houston
Tex will also- Dr DeSuassure
(Dynamite Dick) is County H.O. at Bruns
wick Ga, writes his county have
$5000 for malaria work this season-
The season is opening up with good prospects
Fuchs is out along the Mo. Pacific Ry
making surveys as they are interested.
